body_html:
Hey, so the equivalent operation of

net = tf.placeholder(tf.float32, [10, 255, 255, 3])
net = lays.conv2d(net, 16, [5, 5], stride=2, padding='SAME')

in tf.nn is

filters = tf.get_variable('Conv/weights', [5, 5, 3, 16], tf.float32) 
biases =  tf.get_variable('Conv/bias', [16], tf.float32)
net = tf.nn.conv2d(net, filters, [1, 2, 2, 1], padding='SAME') + biases

since the first and last dimension of the net is batch_size and channel, when we do convolution, we don't put stride on them.
body_text:
Hey, so the equivalent operation of
net = tf.placeholder(tf.float32, [10, 255, 255, 3])
net = lays.conv2d(net, 16, [5, 5], stride=2, padding='SAME')

in tf.nn is
filters = tf.get_variable('Conv/weights', [5, 5, 3, 16], tf.float32) 
biases =  tf.get_variable('Conv/bias', [16], tf.float32)
net = tf.nn.conv2d(net, filters, [1, 2, 2, 1], padding='SAME') + biases

since the first and last dimension of the net is batch_size and channel, when we do convolution, we don't put stride on them.
body:
Hey, so the equivalent operation of 
```
net = tf.placeholder(tf.float32, [10, 255, 255, 3])
net = lays.conv2d(net, 16, [5, 5], stride=2, padding='SAME')
```
in `tf.nn` is
```
filters = tf.get_variable('Conv/weights', [5, 5, 3, 16], tf.float32) 
biases =  tf.get_variable('Conv/bias', [16], tf.float32)
net = tf.nn.conv2d(net, filters, [1, 2, 2, 1], padding='SAME') + biases
``` 
since the first and last dimension of the net is batch_size and channel, when we do convolution, we don't put stride on them.
